snippet: Abuse survivors, government ministers, priests, canon lawyers, police officials and human rights advocates were among those calling on Cardinal Sean Brady to step down.
abstract: Many public officials and abuse survivors call for the leader of the Catholic Church in Ireland, Cardinal Sean Brady, to resign in the wake of accusations made against him in a BBC television documentary about his role in a secret inquiry into clerical sexual abuse; Brady had admitted that in 1975 he failed to report damning evidence against Rev Brendan Smyth.
lead_paragraph: Abuse survivors, government ministers, priests, canon lawyers, police officials and human rights advocates were among those calling on Cardinal Sean Brady to step down.

headline.seo: Pressure Grows on Ireland’s Cardinal Brady to Resign
headline.main: Calls Grow for Cardinal in Ireland to Resign
headline.print_headline: Calls Grow For Cardinal In Ireland To Resign
